title: Band, 1951-132-4, 11th–12th century
medium:
Medium: wool
Technique:  woven tape with braided ends
dimensions: Overall: 300 x 1 cm (9 ft. 10 1/8 in. x 3/8 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Agnes M. O'Donnell
description: Long narrow wool band with series of "S" repeats, series of angular scroll repeats, and series of rectangular repeats made up of triangles, in dark green, red, white; framed top and bottom with green, yellow, brown guard stripes.  Warps at each end plaited in two strips which merge into single thicker plait after 1"; separate again 1" from end and terminate in 4" fringe; chevron striped in plaited area from different warp colors.

exhibitions.title: Extreme Textiles: Designing for High Performance
